revised_title: Sodium Channels in the Axolemma of Degenerating Rabbit Optic Nerve
tldr: This study investigates the sodium channel density in the axolemma of the rabbit optic nerve before and after crush-induced degeneration. The results show that the sodium channel density decreases significantly after crush, suggesting that central glial cells, such as astrocytes and oligodendrocytes, do not bind saxitoxin. The findings indicate that the saturable binding of saxitoxin to the rabbit optic nerve is entirely to the axolemma.
